message: To fully review the app I realize you'll need to be invited - if you let me know that you requested an invite and who you are I'll get an invite sent out to you right then.
Here's the quick description: Talentopoly.com is a community for programmers, designers, and IT professionals to share what they're reading, ask questions, and find others to work with.
Just signed up and it's looking good!
Thanks! Any and all feedback welcomed and encouraged.
@jaredbrown I'd really love to get an invite
@jaredbrown I'd love an invite, requested one on the site.
Site looks nice, requested an invite on the site and looking forward to checking it out
It's focused on link sharing
@jaredbrown requested an invite
I'm considering changing the description of the site. What do you think of the current description on Talentopoly.com? Would you be interested in voting on the best description if I started a poll?
Just shot you an invite @webster
@akuril, if you could tell me your first name I can find your invite request and send you an invite.
Invite sent to @equinox
The idea behind Talentopoly is for designers, developers, and IT pros to share links to cool articles and things they find on the interwebs.
Invite sent @kai

The hope is to attain a low signal to noise ratio, especially with the popular posts page further removing the noise. I've already meant insanely talented designers and devs through it, which has been a thrill!
I really am looking for feedback from this community as I respect you guys (HN users) more than any other community.
@jaredbrown Thanks!
If you request an invite on the site and let me know I'll shoot one out to you ASAP.
Thanks! Look forward to seeing more of you on the site.
Not posting design work
Kai - Let me know what you think. Welcome to the site!
@jaredbrown I've been checking out the site so far, looks good, but it's missing a search feature
Thanks for the feedback - it's on the roadmap - I actually ask users to vote on what I implement next. http://talentopoly.com/static/construction_plans
I had a beta of the site up back in late Oct of last year.
@jaredbrown would also be nice if you can keep it consistent so that membership are by invites only... preserves the quality of the content and site as well
Not sure what you mean. Do you mean do away with invite requests?
how many programmers are working on it?
BTW: I started a Convore Talentopoly topic - http://convore.com/talentopoly/
It's just me developing it
will do
Which is part of Forrst.
In what site?
Thanks for the discussion @awfy
I'll add your suggestion
@jaredbrown may I know how long has this site been on?
@jaredbrown I mean membership should be with invite only, just like now
great!
how long does it take?
No. Though that is actually a common misconception.
I saw that
@jaredbrown posts & questions would be great
The current version of the site has been up since Feb 1st
Oh, I plan on keeping it invite-only ;)
oh wow
I work on it in my spare time, but it is very much a serious endeavor for me. I spend a lot of time on it.
I see
keep up the good work
Is it to compete with things like Forrst and Dribbble?
Whereas on Forrst you can post links and that's something some of the users there do, I've found that having the focus be on sharing links that it changes how people use the feature.
@jaredbrown I tried sending a message to you in that site
@jaredbrown talentopoly
Especially when you're aiming at designers as well as developers.
It's a place for designers and devs to share cool things they're reading and finding on the web.

I could see that @awfy - but I'm hoping to see links to great articles, blog posts, and tutorials in the design community, which doesn't happen so much on sites like Forrst. The focus there is more on posting snaps in my experience.
They allow you to share links, just worried that limiting it to links only makes it seem a little bland in comparison to Forrst.

I think a strong case can be made for how Talentopoly is similar to Forrst, HN, and even Twitter (link sharing). There is overlap, no doubt. But I also think there is room and a need for a pure link aggregation site focused on design & dev (i.e. what the popular articles, blog posts, icon sets, events, deals, resources, etc. at the moment).

Twitter is a good place to drink from the firehose and Forrst has some good links being posted everyday - but on both sites I find that in my experience those links get easily buried and lost in the stream.
@equinox Will reply in a bit
@equinox - Did the message send?
@jaredbrown sure did, you didn't get it?
I find myself wanting something like that @awfy.
@equinox Just got it. Thanks
@jaredbrown sounds interesting, I am on Forrst as well, signed up for invite, looking forward to checking it out.
Thanks for the comment @jackhq. Just sent you your invite.
I'm looking for feedback/discussion about the site. If you want an invite, just request one on the site and let me know.
BTW: You can check out what's being posted on the site at http://talentopoly.com/posts
You missed a place in your Terms of Service -- it still says ResumeBucket ;)

@jaredbrown I feel like the posts page should be a little more compact.  With only 3 articles above the fold (at my resolution), there isn't always something that catches my eye, compared to hacker news or reddit who show 15+ articles, and there is always at least one interesting article
Awesome suggestion
Great feedback @kai. I'll have to think about that one and figure out how it can be done. I completely agree.
Maybe a user preference for compact or full view. Thoughts?
yeah that makes sense
you could ab test the two to see which has better time on site and set that to default

@jaredbrown I had a brief pause while sending the invite request. I wasn't sure if the form wanted "@micrypt" or "micrypt". Perhaps leaving out the "(@ ...)" tip and handling it on the backend would help.
@micrypt - Yep that's on the to do list, thanks for the suggestion, it confirms it needs to be a priority.

I've trying an experiment on HN today. I want to see if the community can evolve the current description for Talentopoly into one that better describes the aim of the site. http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2250042
I'd be interested in an invite if you have room! :)
Thanks for taking a look @equinox. What do you want to search most, posts, users, or questions?
